intro: Scleromitrion largiflorens, commonly known as the large-flowered rock cress, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant is characterized by its basal rosette of thick, fleshy leaves and tall, branching stems that bear clusters of bright yellow flowers. Its flowers are typically 1–2 cm in diameter, with four distinct petals and prominent stamens. Scleromitrion largiflorens is adapted to rocky and arid environments, showcasing a range of morphological features that aid in water conservation and survival in harsh conditions.
